note.p: Birth: Newark, Bay of Islands, New Zealand (09 October 1838)
Death: Pontdail Lodge, Fleet, Hampshire (19 July 1906)
Education: Wesley High School, New Zealand. ScD (Tubingen)

Career: Learnt to speak Maori; Government interpreter, Wellington (1855); Resident Magistrate of the Wanganui District, New Zealand (1862); Judge of the native land court (1865); went to England (1871); called to the Bar, Inner Temple (1874); returned to New Zealand; practised at the Supreme Court (to 1886); returned to England (1886)
References: Robin J H Clark and Michael J Kelly, 'New Zealand, New Zealanders and the Royal Society' in NR 1994 vol 48 pp 263-281
Notes: Warren De La Rue has signed election certificate twice
